title: Do Perms Damage Your Hair? Risks, Preparation, and Aftercare

steps.title: No, not if you have virgin or unprocessed hair.
steps.content: No, not if you have virgin or unprocessed hair. While there is a misconception that perms will leave your hair damaged and dry, if your hair is already healthy, a perm shouldn’t do too much damage. If you have lightened or bleached hair, getting a perm is slightly riskier, so it’s important to go to a professional. [1] X Research source If you have colored or bleached hair, make sure you use a perm for colored hair. It will be less damaging and protect your hair more. Hot perms (or acid perms) are slightly less damaging than cold perms (or alkaline perms). If you have damaged or bleached hair, consider asking your stylist about a hot perm.

steps.title: Your hair might get dry or frizzy.
steps.content: Your hair might get dry or frizzy. Getting a perm changes the outer layers of your hair, which can lead to dry, frizzy locks. If your hair is already damaged or dry from bleaching or coloring, a perm might not be for you.

steps.title: Your hair could be weakened.
steps.content: Your hair could be weakened. Perm chemicals change the protein bonds within your hair. After a perm, a lot of your natural moisture is lost, and you might be prone to split ends and breakage, especially on the ends of your hair. Perming your hair the first time usually isn’t the problem, it’s perming multiple times over already damaged hair. You may notice that your hair becomes drier and frizzier as you get more perms.

steps.title: Use conditioning treatments.
steps.content: Use conditioning treatments. Perms are very drying, and they remove a lot of moisture from your hair. In the days and weeks leading up to your perm, use a deep conditioner and a hair mask as often as you can. You’ll lock in hydration so your hair isn’t as dry and frizzy after your service. steps.title: Around 6 months.
steps.content: Around 6 months. It depends a lot on how fast your hair grows and how well you take care of your hair. Most people need a new perm about twice a year. [3] X Research source It’s super important to moisturize your hair after you’ve gotten a perm. Use a deep conditioner and a hair mask at least once a week to rebuild your hair strands and give yourself a healthy head of hair. steps.title: They can if they are applied too close to the scalp.
steps.content: They can if they are applied too close to the scalp. If the perm chemicals get too close to your skin, you run the risk of getting chemical burns, which can cause hair loss. As long as the perm chemicals stay on your hair strands and not your scalp, it shouldn’t cause any issues. [5] X Research source Keep in mind that perms can cause hair breakage, though. The chemicals in perms cause swelling of the hair follicle, which can lead to it breaking off. [6] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Yes, if you wash it right away.
steps.content: Yes, if you wash it right away. Most perms take 48 hours to neutralize, which is why hair stylists recommend waiting 2 days before washing your hair. If you don’t like your perm, hop in the shower as soon as possible and wash your hair with shampoo. Use a conditioner to hydrate your hair and protect it from any damage. [7] X Research source If it’s been longer than 2 days, you may not be able to undo a perm . The best thing to do for your hair is to use deep conditioning treatments for moisture.

steps.title: Use conditioner and hair masks.
steps.content: Use conditioner and hair masks. Perms have the potential to make your hair feel dry. To give your hair some hydration, use a conditioner every time you wash your hair. Try doing a deep conditioning treatment or a hair mask at least once a week to lock in moisture and prevent damage. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Detangle your hair with a wide-tooth comb.
steps.content: Detangle your hair with a wide-tooth comb. To prevent stretching out the curls too much, use a wide-tooth comb rather than a fine-tooth comb. If you stretch your hair too much, it can lose some of the elasticity, leading to droopy curls.

steps.title: Try not to use heat styling tools.
steps.content: Try not to use heat styling tools. Hair dryers, straighteners, and curling irons can damage your hair further. Whenever it’s possible, try to let your hair air dry naturally. If you got a curly perm, use a bit of hair gel to pump up your curls and make them look great.
